action.action-desc: Ms. Spanberger (for herself and Mr. Moore of Utah) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To change the treatment of certain Federal programs with respect to susceptibility to significant improper payments, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Preventing Improper Payments Act.

section.header: Treatment of certain new programs and activities
section.text: Section 3352(a) of title 31, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Any program or activity established by a Federal agency on or after the date of the enactment of this paragraph making more than $100,000,000 in payments in a fiscal year shall be construed to be a program or activity with outlays exceeding the statutory threshold dollar amount described in paragraph (3)(A)(i) that may be susceptible to significant improper payment.

section.text: Section 3357(d) of title 31, United States Code, is amended by striking For each of fiscal years 2019 and 2020, each and inserting the following: Each.
